channel.title: Tech Insights
channel.description: Daily curated news on AI, developer tools, and the tech industry

item.title: Happening Now: DEV Weekend Challenge!! Submissions due March 2 at 7:59am UTC.
item.description: Good morning! Good afternoon! Good Evening! Welcome to our first DEV Weekend Challenge, a short focused challenge designed to fit into your weekend. Our submission window is intentionally tight,...

item.title: Story Points are Utter Nonsense
item.description: For over a decade, I've lived a lie. I made myself believe that Agile Story points made sense. I rationalised it like we all did. "They map to complexity, not time". Yet we spend hours on Sprint...

item.title: I Deleted All My MCP Servers and Everything Got Faster
item.description: In my last post I described a PKM system held together by Ansible, git, and a small fleet of MCP servers. Eight of them, to be precise. ArXiv, Semantic Scholar, Google Workspace, Obsidian,...

item.title: How Instagram Reels Are Becoming a Goldmine for AI Image Prompts

item.title: Drupal Blog Inside Drupal Cms 2 Qa

item.title: Hands-On With Nano Banana 2, the Latest Version of Google’s AI Image Generator
item.description: Google’s latest image model, Nano Banana 2, is a powerful AI photo editor that punctures reality. Well, sometimes.

item.title: Jack Dorsey just halved the size of Block’s employee base — and he says your company is next
item.description: Jack Dorsey has long been an open admirer of Elon Musk. Now, it seems, he may have been taking notes.

item.title: Anthropic refuses Pentagon’s new terms, standing firm on lethal autonomous weapons and mass surveillance
item.description: Less than 24 hours before the deadline in an ultimatum issued by the Pentagon, Anthropic has refused the Department of Defense's demands for unrestricted access to its AI. It's the culmination of...

item.title: ‘Uncanny Valley’: Pentagon vs. ‘Woke’ Anthropic, Agentic vs. Mimetic, and Trump vs. State of the Union
item.description: Our hosts unpack the news of the week, starting with the ongoing feud between Anthropic and the Pentagon. Plus: All you need to know about TAT-8 and undersea cables.

item.title: Anthropic CEO stands firm as Pentagon deadline looms
item.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said Thursday that he "cannot in good conscience accede" to the Pentagon's demands to give the military unrestricted access to its AI systems.

item.title: Netflix walks away from its deal to buy Warner Bros. after Paramount came back with a better offer
item.description: Netflix has dropped its $83 billion deal to acquire the Warner Bros. studio, HBO, and its streaming service HBO Max. In an announcement on Thursday, co-CEOs Ted Sarandos and Greg Peters say the...

item.title: Microsoft’s Copilot Tasks AI uses its own computer to get things done
item.description: Microsoft is previewing a new AI system, Copilot Tasks, that it says is designed to take care of busywork for you in the background, the company announced on Thursday. The feature takes the load...

item.title: Jack Dorsey’s Block cuts nearly half of its staff in AI gamble
item.description: Jack Dorsey's Block, the financial tech company that runs Square and the Cash app, is cutting its workforce by "nearly half" and axing more than 4,000 jobs. The company will shrink from more than...

item.title: Lenovo leak reveals a foldable gaming handheld that’s also a Windows laptop
item.description: Lenovo's next gaming laptop could be a shapeshifting foldable called the Legion Go Fold, which can be used as a laptop or a handheld gaming PC with two different display sizes, as WindowsLatest...

item.title: Why no magnets in Galaxy S26? Samsung R&D chief explains
item.description: Magnet rings have changed my life. I grip and mount and satisfyingly snap awesome accessories on and off my phone all day. Even Samsung sells neat ones, like these folding magnetic mirrors. But...

item.title: Smartphone sales could be in for their biggest drop ever
item.description: The smartphone industry could experience a record-breaking decline in 2026 as a result of the RAM shortage stemming from memory-hungry AI giants. That's according to the latest report from the...

item.title: Samsung exec confirms you can blame RAM — and other materials — for the Galaxy S26’s higher price tag
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy S26 and S26 Plus are "more of the same for more money," my colleague Allison Johnson reported this week. Now, Samsung is confirming what we previously only suspected: RAMageddon...

item.title: This AI Agent Is Designed to Not Go Rogue
item.description: The new open source project IronCurtain uses a unique method to secure and constrain AI assistant agents before they flip your digital life upside down.

item.description: The Federal Trade Commission is encouraging companies to adopt age verification technologies by announcing it will not enforce a children's online privacy law against certain websites that collect...

item.title: Qualcomm won’t be announcing Windows gaming handhelds at GDC after all

item.title: So, we’re getting Prada Meta AI glasses, right?
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg was at Prada's fashion week event in Milan, leaving everyone to wonder if we're getting Meta AI glasses under the Prada brand.

item.title: How Chinese AI Chatbots Censor Themselves
item.description: Researchers from Stanford and Princeton found that Chinese AI models are more likely than their Western counterparts to dodge political questions or deliver inaccurate answers.

item.title: Sophia Space raises $10M seed to demo novel space computers
item.description: The company's modular computer tiles offer a new vision for space data centers.

item.title: Mistral AI inks a deal with global consulting giant Accenture
item.description: Mistral AI lands a partnership with Accenture, the consultant that has also recently announced partnerships with rivals OpenAI and Anthropic.

item.title: Are You ‘Agentic’ Enough for the AI Era?
item.description: Silicon Valley built AI coding agents that can handle most of the grunt work. Now, the most valuable skill in tech is deciding what they should do.
